issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
This is not a regression.
Styles_15_Global-Controller app shows different behaviour on iOS and android.

Steps to reproduce:
1.Using project: titanium_mobile_tests_internal/Alloy/TestCases/Styles/Styles_15_Global-Controller
2. Run the project on both Android and iOS platform.

Result on Android: 
Text "White Label on Blue background" appears with white text.

Result on iOS:
Text "White Label on Blue background" appears with black text.

Please refer the attached screenshot for your reference.
fields.summary: Parity Issue: app shows different behaviour on iOS and android
fields.environment:
Appc Studio: 3.3.0.201406061445
SDK build: 3.3.0.v20140609184912
acs: 1.0.14
npm: 1.3.2
alloy: 1.4.0-beta2
CLI: titanium-3.3.0-beta3
titanium-code-processor:1.1.1
Xcode: 5.1.1
Osx: Mavericks(10.9.2)
Device: iPhone 5S (7.1.1) and Galaxy Nexus (4.1.1)

comments.body:
Unable to reproduce:
Mac OSX 10.9.3
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201406111952
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140617102513
Titanium CLI, build: 3.3.0-rc
Alloy: 1.4.0-rc

Used the test case specified in the description.
Both iOS and Android display the label with white text.

Also not able to reproduce.

Mac OSX 10.9.3
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.3.0.201406111952
Titanium SDK, build: 3.3.0.v20140617102513
Titanium CLI, build: 3.3.0-rc
Alloy: 1.4.0-rc

xcode:5.1.1
OS:Maverick(10.9.3)
Device:iPhone5c(v7.1.1),LG-P970(V4.0.3),iPhone5s(v7.1.1)

Issue is not reproducible.
Working as expected.

Closing the issue.
Since it is not reproducible.
Working fine for both ios and android.
